t: 2 Samuel 22
David’s Psalm of Deliverance
And*p David spoke the words of this song to the Lord*s in the day that the Lord*s delivered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul.
He said, “The*pn Lord*s is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer;
My*ln God, my rock, in whom I take refuge, My*ln shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold and my refuge; My*ln savior, You save me from violence.
I*ln call upon the Lord,*s who is worthy to be praised, And*ln I am saved from my enemies.
For*ln the waves of death encompassed me; The*ln torrents of destruction overwhelmed me;
The*ln cords of Sheol surrounded me; The*ln snares of death confronted me.
In*ln my distress I called upon the Lord,*s Yes,*ln I cried to my God; And*ln from His temple He heard my voice, And*ln my cry for help came*i into His ears.
Then*ln the earth shook and quaked, The*ln foundations of heaven were trembling And*ln were shaken, because He was angry.
Smoke*ln went up out of His nostrils, Fire*ln from His mouth devoured; Coals*ln were kindled by it.
He*ln bowed the heavens also, and came down With*ln thick darkness under His feet.
And*ln He rode on a cherub and flew; And*ln He appeared on the wings of the wind.
And*ln He made darkness canopies around Him, A*ln mass of waters, thick clouds of the sky.
From*ln the brightness before Him Coals*ln of fire were kindled.
The*ln Lord*s thundered from heaven, And*ln the Most High uttered His voice.
And*ln He sent out arrows, and scattered them, Lightning,*ln and routed them.
Then*ln the channels of the sea appeared, The*ln foundations of the world were laid bare By*ln the rebuke of the Lord,*s At*ln the blast of the breath of His nostrils.
He*ln sent from on high, He took me; He*ln drew me out of many waters.
He*ln delivered me from my strong enemy, From*ln those who hated me, for they were too strong for me.
They*ln confronted me in the day of my calamity, But*ln the Lord*s was my support.
He*ln also brought me forth into a broad place; He*ln rescued me, because He delighted in me.
The*ln Lord*s has rewarded me according to my righteousness; According*ln to the cleanness of my hands He has recompensed me.
For*ln I have kept the ways of the Lord,*s And*ln have not acted wickedly against my God.
For*ln all His ordinances were*i before me, And*ln as*i for*i His statutes, I did not depart from them.
I*ln was also blameless toward Him, And*ln I kept myself from my iniquity.
Therefore*ln the Lord*s has recompensed me according to my righteousness, According*ln to my cleanness before His eyes.
With*ln the kind You show Yourself kind, With*ln the blameless You show Yourself blameless;
With*ln the pure You show Yourself pure, And*ln with the perverted You show Yourself astute.
And*ln You save an afflicted people; But*ln Your eyes are on the haughty whom*i You abase.
For*ln You are my lamp, O Lord;*s And*ln the Lord*s illumines my darkness.
For*ln by You I can run upon a troop; By*ln my God I can leap over a wall.
As*ln for God, His way is blameless; The*ln word of the Lord*s is tested; He*ln is a shield to all who take refuge in Him.
For*ln who is God, besides the Lord?*s And*ln who is a rock, besides our God?
God*ln is my strong fortress; And*ln He sets the blameless in His way.
He*ln makes my feet like hinds’ feet,*i And*ln sets me on my high places.
He*ln trains my hands for battle, So*ln that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
You*ln have also given me the shield of Your salvation, And*ln Your help makes me great.
You*ln enlarge my steps under me, And*ln my feet have not slipped.
I*ln pursued my enemies and destroyed them, And*ln I did not turn back until they were consumed.
And*ln I have devoured them and shattered them, so that they did not rise; And*ln they fell under my feet.
For*ln You have girded me with strength for battle; You*ln have subdued under me those who rose up against me.
You*ln have also made my enemies turn their*i backs to me, And*ln I destroyed those who hated me.
They*ln looked, but there was none to save; Even*iln to the Lord,*s but He did not answer them.
Then*ln I pulverized them as the dust of the earth; I*ln crushed and*i stamped them as the mire of the streets.
You*ln have also delivered me from the contentions of my people; You*ln have kept me as head of the nations; A*ln people whom I have not known serve me.
Foreigners*ln pretend obedience to me; As*ln soon as they hear, they obey me.
Foreigners*ln lose heart, And*ln come trembling out of their fortresses.
The*ln Lord*s lives, and blessed be my rock; And*ln exalted be God, the rock of my salvation,
The*ln God who executes vengeance for me, And*ln brings down peoples under me,
Who*ln also brings me out from my enemies; You*ln even lift me above those who rise up against me; You*ln rescue me from the violent man.
Therefore*ln I will give thanks to You, O Lord,*s among the nations, And*ln I will sing praises to Your name.
He*iln is a tower of deliverance to His king, And*ln shows lovingkindness to His anointed, To*ln David and his descendants forever.”
